data.title: Field trips
data.text: I took a group of 6th grade students here, and the guides were very good with the students, and actually kept them entertained. Not having many places to go on field trips in the area, this place is a real find.

data.title: Very Nice!
data.text: My wife and I have traveled throughout the USA and stayed in many RV Parks. Every time we come to this park we are always impressed about how well it is maintained. The grounds and facilities are well kept and there is always a presence of “Caring” throughout the park. The personnel working here are always polite and friendly and make us feel like being in a “Home away from home” environment. One of our main concerns has always been feeling safe and secure wherever we stay. We most definitely feel this here. The park rules are fair and easy to adhere to. It is a “Pet Friendly” park and has a very nice Pet Park for our dogs needs. We like the location as it has is not too far from downtown Wichita Falls, Shopping and Sheppard Air Force Base.

data.title: A great place to visit
data.text: The MNTH is NOT your run of the mill junk, antique, or second hand clothing store that downtown WF has so very many of.  MNTH is a wonderful  (and huge) place to explore and learn tons of info about the history of north Texas and of the USA in general.  The exhibits, many of which are meticulously hand made, are simply fantastic.  Plan to stay a while when you go.....you will be amazed.  The exhibits right now (22 Apr 17) are especially neat!  Admission is free.

data.title: Just passing by...
data.text: This was an ok experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They were a bit distracted because they were getting ready for an event later. Therefore, I had no "tour guide services"... Kinda just led myself around reading everything. The temperature was very uncomfortable inside of the building. HOT! No AC to combat the upper 80s temp outside. However, it's a good place to go to learn the history of the area for NO CHARGE...Donations are needed and should be enforced for upgrading purposes. I'm from Louisiana, so I REALLY DID value the experience despite the technicalities.  May visit again.

data.title: Very Interesting
data.text: Great place to see and find out the history of the Wichita Falls area.  They have interesting new displays and information.

data.title: classic "small town" museum
data.text: The docent had to turn on the lights when we came in ("gotta save on electricity") - gave us some personal insight into some of the displays.  For me the most noteworthy was a collection of cowboy hats collected through time - IMPRESSIVE.  Also had a lot of military memorabilia of townsfolk from WWll.  Other miscellaneous collections as well as one might expect.  A fun way to spend a half hour or so - it's free but they can clearly use donations  :)

data.title: Worth visiting
data.text: I could have spent several hours at the museum, but my children were only interested for an hour or two. They have interesting displays with plenty of written information to read, but nothing interactive for children. My children struggled with all of the "No touch" signs as they tend to touch to learn and wanted to, for example, touch the iron lung to see what it felt like. We were here during the temporary "Black History Month" exhibit and found the woman who was there enthralling with her knowledge of black history in Wichita Falls and North Texas. This is a free museum and definitely worth the time to go through, but prepared to hold your children back from touching anything.

data.title: Great place for the value
data.text: The WW1 and WW2 was a great exhibit. So much to see past and current. The towns history was amazing. Would so go again it is a must see for the whole family.

data.title: Small Local History Museum
data.text: Nice little Local Museum about local History...Many Displays are rotated. Everything from Cowboy Hat Collection from the "Cowlot" to military displays and oilfield.  Small but affordable. I believe $5 entrance fee. nice place to visit when Downtown for a day trip

data.title: Learning About This Area of Texas
data.text: This place is an interesting way to spend a few hours for the curious.  The staff have done a great job with the displays.  I just didn't know there was so much history in this part of Texas.

data.title: Nice Museum
data.text: Local racing exhibit is great addition. Little museum will a nice little punch! Wide variety of exhibits from racing, WWII, western heritage.

data.title: Small but good
data.text: The exhibits were well done & lots of info is available. Usually there is something seasonal or otherwise special on display.

data.title: Great Overview of Wichita Falls History
data.text: My wife and stopped by one weekend and found several interesting exhibits. The volunteers were very knowledgeable and helpful.

data.title: Older museum with a friendly staff and SOME great exhibits
data.text: A bit rough around the edges and stale smelling, but there are some interesting things, including an iron lung -- which I had never seen before -- and much more. Exhibits range from very interesting to very mundane. Too many signs telling you not to touch and notifying you of past thefts. There's more to see around every corner.

data.title: Loved the Artifacts
data.text: Very enjoyable for the whole family; although our three-year-old granddaughter was not that impressed.

data.title: Opening hours
data.text:
Hours 10-16
Closed sunday and monday
Small museum - takes about 1 hour
Very interesting for adults but not for children.

data.title: Fun Museum-Lots to See
data.text: The Museum of North Texas History was a little unusual and a lot of fun. The museum is free [donations appreciated] and includes about 14 rooms. I was surprised at the variety of exhibits and displays, from the history of a Wichita Falls native professional race car driver [and a couple of his cars] to Native American artifacts, a huge cowboy hat collection, vintage hand tools, model of an oil drilling rig, and a number of rooms displaying military uniforms and patches and models of military warships and aircraft. I enjoyed visiting with one of the docents as he showed me the model trains and re-created city built with the help of local school children. A lot to see and friendly volunteers to answer your questions. This is a fun and educational place to spend about an hour.

data.title: Good Free museum, well worth a visit. Hats were an expected stand out.
data.text:
We didnt have any real pre conception of what we would see here and how well it would be laid out and for a free museum we were a bit blown away at how much stuff they had and how well laid our it was.

The rooms lead around the building and offer some things you just dont see, like the hat collection. bizarre, and very cool.

Go here, its a great hour+ worth of things to see.

data.title: Vacation / Passing Through
data.text: As a family, we decided to take our time traveling to Colorado so we could take advantage of local attractions along the way. All three of us were pleasantly surprised by the exhibits and the friendly staff. It is a free attraction and each exhibit is outstanding. Budget one hour of time to view everything.

data.title: Love it!
data.text: The staff was extremely friendly and knowledgeable.  I loved being able to walk through and read all of the information. They have a personal journal for a military member that included WW II battles that was neat to read.
